Skateboarding originated in the United States in the 1950s. It was first popularized by surfers who wanted to find a way to practice their skills when the waves were flat. Skateboarding quickly spread to other countries and has become a popular sport and hobby around the world.
Skateboarding originated in California in the 1950s when surfers began experimenting with wooden boards attached to roller skate wheels. It quickly became a popular sport and spread around the world.
